levels.label: Combinatorics
levels.description: The study of counting and arranging objects.

levels.label: Regression
levels.description: The study of the relationship between variables.

levels.label: Bayesian Statistics
levels.description: The study of probability as a measure of uncertainty.

levels.label: Binary Trees
levels.description: A tree data structure in which each node has at most two children.

levels.label: Linked Lists
levels.description: A linear collection of elements, where each element points to the next.

levels.label: Polymorphism
levels.description: The ability to present the same interface for different data types.

levels.label: Design Patterns
levels.description: A general reusable solution to a commonly occurring problem.

levels.label: Binary Search
levels.description: A search algorithm that finds the position of a target value within a sorted array.

levels.label: Dijkstra's
levels.description: An algorithm for finding the shortest path between nodes in a graph.

levels.label: NP-Completeness
levels.description: A class of problems for which no efficient solution is known.

levels.label: Fibonacci Sequence
levels.description: A sequence of numbers in which each number is the sum of the two preceding ones.

levels.label: Memoization
levels.description: An optimization technique used primarily to speed up computer programs.

levels.label: State Machine Optimization
levels.description: A mathematical model of computation used to design both computer programs and sequential logic circuits.

levels.label: Decision Tree
levels.description: A decision support tool that uses a tree-like graph or model of decisions and their possible consequences.

levels.label: Dimensionality Reduction
levels.description: The process of reducing the number of random variables under consideration.

levels.label: Neural Networks
levels.description: A network or circuit of neurons, or in a modern sense, an artificial neural network.
